mapper.sql: userid, age, gender, tel, postbox, bir, address, ED
mapper.insert: insert into userinfo (userid, age, gender, tel, postbox, bir, address, ED) values (#{userid,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{age,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{gender,jdbcType=CHAR}, #{tel,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{postbox,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{bir,jdbcType=DATE}, #{address,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{ed,jdbcType=DATE})

update userinfo
age = #{age,jdbcType=INTEGER},
gender = #{gender,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
tel = #{tel,jdbcType=INTEGER},
postbox = #{postbox,jdbcType=INTEGER},
bir = #{bir,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
address = #{address,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
ed = #{ed,jdbcType=VARCHAR},

update userinfo set age = #{age,jdbcType=INTEGER}, gender = #{gender,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, tel = #{tel,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, postbox = #{postbox,jdbcType=INTEGER}, bir = #{bir,jdbcType=INTEGER}, address = #{address,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, ed = #{ed,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where userid = #{userid,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.select:
select * from userinfo
and tel like '%${tel}%'
and postbox like '%${postbox}%'
limit #{start},#{rows}

select count(*) from userinfo
and tel like '%${tel}%'
and postbox like '%${postbox}%'
